title: Pembrokeshire Island Explorer
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8+, nature enthusiasts, and anyone seeking gentle outdoor adventures. Those comfortable with boat trips and short walks.
notSuitableFor: Individuals with limited mobility or those seeking extreme adventure activities. Very young children (under 5) may find the boat trips challenging.

stops.title: Boat Trip - Ramsey Island
stops.description: Explore the rugged coastline of Ramsey Island and spot seals, seabirds, and maybe even dolphins on this guided boat tour.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the magnificent St Davids Cathedral, a historic and architectural gem.

budgetAlt.title: Coastal Walk to St Justinian's Chapel
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path to the ruins of St Justinian's Chapel.

stops.title: The Refectory
stops.description: A cafe near St Davids Cathedral with delicious homemade food and cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic at Whitesands Beach with stunning views.

stops.title: Surfing Lesson
stops.description: Learn to surf at the famous Whitesands Beach with TYF Adventure's expert instructors. All equipment provided.

wetAlt.title: TYF Adventure Centre Visit
wetAlt.description: Learn about sustainable adventures and browse eco-friendly gear at the TYF Adventure Centre in St Davids.

budgetAlt.title: Walk the Pembrokeshire Coast Path
budgetAlt.description: Take a walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path above Whitesands Beach towards St Davids Head for stunning views.

stops.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
stops.description: A sustainable campsite at Porthclais Harbour, perfect for enjoying the sea views and dark skies.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping (with permission)
budgetAlt.description: Find a spot and camp along the coast.

stops.title: Sea Kayaking Safari
stops.description: Explore the Pembrokeshire coastline by kayak with TYF Adventure, paddling along cliffs, into caves, and spotting wildlife.

wetAlt.title: National Wool Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the wool industry in Wales. Located in Drefach Felindre.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Porthclais Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Wander around Porthclais Harbour, enjoy the views, and watch the boats.

stops.title: Stackpole Inn
stops.description: Traditional pub serving hearty meals and local ales near Stackpole Quay.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Barafundle Bay
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic at the beautiful Barafundle Bay.

stops.title: Paddle Boarding
stops.description: Paddle board in Barafundle Bay. Outer Reef Surf School runs lessons here in the summer.

wetAlt.title: Pembroke Castle
wetAlt.description: Visit the imposing Pembroke Castle with a fascinating history.

budgetAlt.title: Walk to Broadhaven South
budgetAlt.description: Take a scenic walk along the coast path from Barafundle Bay to Broadhaven South.

stops.title: Stackpole Centre (National Trust)
stops.description: Cottages and camping facilities near Stackpole Quay, offering a comfortable base for exploring the area.

budgetAlt.title: Broadhaven Camping
budgetAlt.description: Campsite close to Broadhaven South Beach.

stops.title: Coasteering
stops.description: Experience the thrill of coasteering with Tenby Adventure, scrambling along the coastline, jumping into the sea, and exploring caves.

wetAlt.title: Tenby Museum and Art Gallery
wetAlt.description: Discover the history of Tenby at the Tenby Museum and Art Gallery.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Tenby's Beaches
budgetAlt.description: Wander around Tenby's beaches and walk along the harbour.

stops.title: The Mooring
stops.description: Seafood restaurant in Tenby with views of the harbor.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic on Castle Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic on Castle Beach in Tenby.

stops.title: Freshwater West beach walk
stops.description: Take a walk at Freshwater West, a beach famous for its dunes and surfing. Great spot for spotting wildlife.

wetAlt.title: Carew Castle and Tidal Mill
wetAlt.description: Explore the Carew Castle and Tidal Mill, two of Pembrokeshire's most historic sites.

budgetAlt.title: Dune exploration
budgetAlt.description: Explore the dunes at Freshwater West

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Pembrokeshire weather can be unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, even in summer. Sea conditions can affect boat trips and kayaking.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in St Davids and Tenby during peak season. Arrive early to find parking. The road to St Justinian's (for Ramsey Island boat trips) is narrow; allow extra time.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Boat trips to Ramsey Island and Skomer Island, as well as coasteering and kayaking activities, should be booked well in advance, especially during school holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary involves moderate walking, including coastal paths. A reasonable level of fitness is required. Coasteering requires a basic level of swimming ability and confidence in the water.
